text: Donald Wrye (September 24, 1934 - May 15, 2015) was an American movie director, screenwriter and producer. He was best known for directing the movie Ice Castles (1978). His career began in 1966. Wrye was born in Riverside, California. He was married to Kathryn Dowling Wrye. Wrye died in his sleep on May 15, 2015 at his home in Harrisburg, Pennsylvania.
